Armenia: Establishment of Armenian printing press in Constantinople.
Belgium:
Attempted Calvinist coup in Antwerp.
Margaret of Parma reinstitutes suspended edicts against heresy.
Chile:
Chiloé Archipelago is claimed by Spain. Martín Ruiz de Gamboa founds Castro on the main island; the southernmost European settlement at that time.
Real Audiencia in Concepción starts its functions. The Audiencia is abolished in 1575.
China: The Jiajing Emperor died. The Jiajing Emperor's son the Longqing Emperor became emperor of the Ming dynasty. The Ming haijin (ban on private maritime commerce) was repealed.
Serbia: The Republic of Venice and the Ottoman Empire clash over Uskoks and their allegiance. The Kingdom of Spain, the Habsburg Empire and the Papal States join the war in support of the Venetians and Uskoks ultimately defeating the Turks. Stojan Janković was one of the military leaders of Dalmatian uskoks and a high-ranking Venetian military officer.
Sweden: Sture Murders carried out on the orders of Eric XIV
